Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API database DB¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

Returns:

The contact created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_birthday(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

The function takes two arguments: skip and limit, which are used to paginate the results. It also takes a db Session object as an argument.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n number of contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned by the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to be used for querying

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database. user (User): The user who is removing this contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified user’s contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being updated

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the json data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.verify_email_phone(email: str, phone: str, db: Session)¶
The verify_email_phone function is used to verify that the email and phone number provided by the user are not already in use.

If either of them are, then an error message will be returned to the user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address to the function

  • phone – str: Pass in the phone number to be verified

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A tuple of email and phone data

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user who’s account is being confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user that we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user that matches the email address, or none if no such user exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id, which is used to find the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh_token field in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent
